caption:
This photograph features a serene riverside setting with the primary focus on a series of traffic signs. The signs, mounted on a wooden post on the right side of the image, display directions and highway information. The top sign is a shield with "WEST" and beneath it a sign reads "INTERSTATE Oregon 80N." Adjacent to these is a round yellow sign showing the number "30," likely indicating a speed limit or another type of route number.

On the left side of the image, the large river dominates the view, reflecting the clear sky above. The river has a calm surface, suggesting mild weather, and is flanked by lush greenery including shrubs and small trees in the foreground. In the distance, rolling hills partly covered in a patchwork of forests and fields complete the scenic backdrop. The horizon is clear, with no visible construction or high-rise buildings, adding to the peacefulness of the setting. No people are visible in this tranquil scene, which seems to emphasize the intersection of human-made signs with the natural landscape.
title: Overlooking the Columbia River at Corbett, near the Cascade Locks on the Lewis and Clark Trail
